exception.default: Ooops! Something went wrong!<newline>Please try again later.</newline>
exception.timeout: Our servers are currently under a high load.<newline>Please try again in a few moments.</newline>
exception.inputLengthWarning: The input text is very long. The server may have truncated the output. Please try again with a shorter text.
exception.inputLengthError: The input text is too long for our model to process. Please try again with a shorter input.
exception.experimentalLanguageWarning: Support for this language is experimental.
exception.fileFailure: Failed to process the file. Please try again.
exception.invalidFileType: Invalid file type. Please upload a {fileTypes} file.
exception.invalidFileSize: File size should be less than {maxFileSize}MB

generic.dragAndDrop: Drag and drop your file here
generic.upload:
Upload a {fileTypes}file

(Supports approx. 10 pages of text)
generic.extensionCTA: Use mitra translate where your texts are; get the <chromelink>Chrome</chromelink>, or <firefoxlink>Firefox</firefoxlink> extension.

footer.blurb: Harnessing AI technologies to promote the scholarly study and personal practice of the dharma. In collaboration with the <link>Tsadra Foundation</link>; powered by Gemini API.

localeSwitcher.label: 切换语言
localeSwitcher.locale: {locale, select, en {English} zh_Hans {简体中文} zh_Hant {繁体中文} other {Unknown}}

search.heading: 搜索2500年的佛教
search.optionCountBadgeLabel: {count, plural, =1 {1 custom search option} other {# custom search options}} set

targetTips.primary: Search canonical and traditional source texts
targetTips.parallel: Search cross-tradition text parallel compiled dataset

tagging.label: Grammar
tagging.heading: Grammatical Analysis
tagging.credit: This grammatical parser supports Sanskrit input and was made possible with data from the <link>Digital Corpus of Sanskrit</link> by Oliver Hellwig.

translation.usageNoticeShort: Dharmamitra's machine translation can make mistakes. Please use responsibly.

usageNoticeLong.p1: Dharmamitra leverages cutting-edge deep neural networks to efficiently provide machine translations. We are working hard to provide the best possible quality. While our technology continues to advance and our services are frequently updated, please keep in mind:
usageNoticeLong.p2: Dharmamitra is designed to complement human expertise, not replace it. By combining our advanced technology with your discernment, you can make the most of our translation services.

ul.1: Dharmamitra is a tool to help understand classical Asian texts preserved in different languages
ul.2: When in doubt, we recommend consulting with language experts, or referring to established human translations.
ul.3: We encourage users to review and verify Dharmamitra's output before sharing it.

placeholders.default: Enter text, or drag and drop a {acceptedFileTypes} file (of upto approx. 10 pages of text). Supports Sanskrit, Tibetan, Buddhist scriptural Chinese and English.
placeholders.englishExplained: Enter Sanskrit text to translate and explaine, using one line per sentence. (Currently, explanation is only available for Sanskrit)

ocr.lengthErrorText: Translation input can support up to {maxInputCharacters} characters (approx. {maxInputPageEquivalent} pages of text). Please try again with a shorter text, or use the OCR feature to process longer texts.
ocr.dragAndDropOverlay:
Supported file types: {fileTypes}

Max characters: {maxInputCharacters} (approx. {maxInputPageEquivalent} pages of text)

Max file size: {maxFileSize}MB

metadata.title: Dharmamitra · a toolkit for the languages of the Dharma
metadata.description: A toolkit for the languages of the Dharma

intro.p1: Dharmamitra has been developed to support Kumarajiva translators in their work translating Dharma texts.

features.p1: Dharmamitra provides both a search engine and a translation service specifically targetting Dharma texts, including traditional source material and modern research literature.

notFound.title: 404 · Page Not Found
notFound.message: No beginning point is found of beings wandering and roaming. <cite>— Assusutta</cite>

ocr.processingTimeNote: Please note that large files can take several minutes to process and it is advised to break them into smaller chunks.
ocr.processingTimeNoteShort: Large files can take several minutes to process.
ocr.largeDownload: The extracted text is larger than 100kB and can be downloaded as a file.
